ground_truth: The shadow of a boy cycling a bike with a dumpy alien in the handlebar basket passes in front of a full moon. A small robot races back and forth through long grass, under a cloudy sky. The robot stops and blinks. Sparks shower in the Lillian Steel Foundry. A detached house on a snowy street has a police car on the drive, and a boy, Joe Lamb, sits on a swing in the garden. He's about 14 and glumly looks down at a locket that he's holding. A wake is being held inside the house. Mr. and Mrs. Kaznyk look at Joe through the window. Some other boys stand by a buffet table. An American 1970s yellow Coupe with a black vinyl roof pulls up outside the house. Joe, from the swing, watches as a good-looking man with shoulder-length blonde hair, Lewis, gets out of the car, glances at Joe, adjusts his hair, and goes into the house. Joe watches as his dad, Jack, bundles Lewis outside and shoves him into the back of the police car on the drive. Jack, a dark-haired man of about 40, sees an apprehensive Joe watching him, then gets in the patrol car and drives it off with its lights flashing. Joe watches as it disappears up the road and looks back down at the locket he's holding before snapping it shut. Excited pupils spill out of Lillian Middle School as it closes for the summer holidays, bicycles are taken out of a bike rack, and Joe is amongst the throng of pupils. One boy from the wake, Charles, comes over to him. Joe looks shocked, as in their movie, a boy, Martin, plays a detective character while another boy, Cary, is a zombie. Martin pulls a gun, but Cary knocks it from his hand. They tussle, and Martin shoves Cary back onto some spikes on the wall, impaling him as blood spills from Cary's mouth while Joe and Charles watch. Joe leaves, and Mr. and Mrs. Kaznyk exchange a look. Outside, Joe cycles across the quiet residential street to his house where Jack's patrol car is on the drive. Joe goes inside, makes his way through the kitchen to the living room, and finds his father weeping in the bathroom and shuts the door on the shocked Joe. Later, Jack and Joe are at a table in Carol's Diner. As they eat, Jack hands Joe a leaflet, and Joe looks unconvinced while Jack takes a pull on a bottle of beer and regards Joe sincerely before turning his attention to the pamphlet.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The silhouette of a lad cycling a bicycle with a pudgy extraterrestrial in the handlebar basket passes in front of a full moon. A small automaton dashes back and forth through tall grass, under a cloudy sky. The automaton halts and blinks. Sparks shower in the Lillian Steel Foundry. A detached dwelling on a snowy street has a police vehicle on the drive, and a boy, Joe Lamb, sits on a swing in the garden. He's about 14 and glumly looks down at a locket that he's holding. A wake is being held inside the house. Mr. and Mrs. Kaznyk gaze at Joe through the window. Some other boys stand by a buffet table. An American 1970s yellow Coupe with a black vinyl roof pulls up outside the house. Joe, from the swing, watches as a handsome man with shoulder-length blonde hair, Lewis, exits the car, glances at Joe, adjusts his hair, and enters the house. Joe watches as his father, Jack, bundles Lewis outside and thrusts him into the back of the police vehicle on the drive. Jack, a dark-haired man of about 40, sees an apprehensive Joe watching him, then enters the patrol vehicle and drives it off with its lights flashing. Joe watches as it vanishes up the road and looks back down at the locket he's holding before snapping it shut. Excited students spill out of Lillian Middle School as it closes for the summer holidays, bicycles are taken out of a bike rack, and Joe is amongst the throng of students. One boy from the wake, Charles, approaches him. Joe looks shocked, as in their film, a lad, Martin, portrays a detective character while another boy, Cary, is a zombie. Martin pulls a firearm, but Cary knocks it from his hand. They tussle, and Martin shoves Cary back onto some spikes on the wall, impaling him as blood spills from Cary's mouth while Joe and Charles watch. Joe departs, and Mr. and Mrs. Kaznyk exchange a glance. Outside, Joe cycles across the quiet residential street to his house where Jack's patrol vehicle is on the drive. Joe enters, makes his way through the kitchen to the living room, and finds his father weeping in the bathroom and shuts the door on the shocked Joe. Later, Jack and Joe are at a counter in Carol's Diner. As they eat, Jack hands Joe a leaflet, and Joe looks unconvinced while Jack takes a swig on a bottle of beer and regards Joe sincerely before turning his attention to the pamphlet.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The shadow of a boy cycling with a dumpy alien in the handlebar basket passes in front of a full moon. A small robot races through long grass under a cloudy sky, stops, and blinks. Sparks fly in the Lillian Steel Foundry. A detached house on a snowy street has a police car in the drive, and Joe Lamb, about 14, sits on a swing, glumly looking at a locket. A wake is inside the house. Mr. and Mrs. Kaznyk watch Joe through the window. Other boys stand by a buffet table. A 1970s yellow Coupe with a black roof pulls up, and Lewis, a good-looking man with shoulder-length blonde hair, gets out, glances at Joe, adjusts his hair, and enters the house. Joe watches as his dad, Jack, bundles Lewis into the police car. Jack, a dark-haired man of about 40, sees Joe watching, then drives off with lights flashing. Joe watches it disappear, then looks at the locket before snapping it shut. Excited pupils spill out of Lillian Middle School for summer holidays, and Joe is among them. Charles, from the wake, approaches Joe. Joe looks shocked as, in their movie, Martin plays a detective and Cary a zombie. Martin pulls a gun, but Cary knocks it away. They tussle, and Martin shoves Cary onto spikes, impaling him as blood spills while Joe and Charles watch. Joe leaves, and Mr. and Mrs. Kaznyk exchange a look. Joe looks unconvinced while Jack drinks beer and regards Joe sincerely before turning to the pamphlet.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: A boy's shadow on a bike with an alien in the basket passes a full moon. A small robot races through grass under a cloudy sky, stops, and blinks. Sparks fly in Lillian Steel Foundry. On a snowy street, a house with a police car has Joe Lamb, 14, on a swing, looking at a locket. A wake is inside. Mr. and Mrs. Kaznyk watch Joe through the window. Boys stand by a buffet. A 1970s yellow Coupe arrives, and Lewis, a handsome man, exits, glances at Joe, and enters the house. Joe's dad, Jack, forces Lewis into the police car and drives off, lights flashing. Joe watches, then snaps the locket shut. Pupils leave Lillian Middle School for summer. Joe is among them. Charles, from the wake, approaches Joe. In their movie, Martin plays a detective, Cary a zombie. They fight, and Cary is impaled. Joe leaves, and Mr. and Mrs. Kaznyk exchange a look. Joe cycles home, finds Jack's patrol car, and sees his father weeping in the bathroom. Later, at Carol's Diner, Jack gives Joe a leaflet. Joe looks unconvinced as Jack drinks beer and focuses on the pamphlet.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: The shadowy silhouette of a young boy riding a bicycle, with a dumpy alien nestled snugly in the basket attached to the handlebars, glides gracefully in front of a large, luminous full moon. Meanwhile, a small, industrious robot scurries back and forth energetically through the long, swaying grass beneath a sky filled with clouds. The robot comes to a sudden halt and blinks its mechanical eyes. Inside the Lillian Steel Foundry, a cascade of bright sparks showers down. On a snowy street, a detached house stands with a police car parked in the driveway, and a boy named Joe Lamb, who appears to be around 14 years old, sits forlornly on a swing in the garden. He gazes down with a somber expression at a locket he holds in his hand. Inside the house, a wake is taking place. Mr. and Mrs. Kaznyk peer out through the window, observing Joe. Nearby, a group of other boys lingers by a buffet table. Outside, an American 1970s yellow Coupe, featuring a sleek black vinyl roof, pulls up in front of the house. From his vantage point on the swing, Joe watches as a handsome man with shoulder-length blonde hair, named Lewis, steps out of the car. Lewis glances briefly at Joe, adjusts his hair with a casual gesture, and proceeds to enter the house. Joe continues to watch as his father, Jack, forcefully escorts Lewis back outside and unceremoniously shoves him into the back of the police car parked in the driveway. Jack, a man with dark hair who appears to be around 40 years old, notices Joe watching with apprehension. He then climbs into the patrol car and drives away, the vehicle's lights flashing as it disappears up the road. Joe watches the car vanish into the distance before turning his attention back to the locket in his hand, snapping it shut with a decisive click. As Lillian Middle School closes its doors for the summer holidays, excited pupils pour out, bicycles are retrieved from the bike rack, and Joe is among the throng of students. One of the boys from the wake, Charles, approaches him. Joe looks visibly shocked, as in their movie, a boy named Martin portrays a detective character while another boy, Cary, plays a zombie. Martin brandishes a gun, but Cary swiftly knocks it from his grasp. They engage in a struggle, and Martin forcefully shoves Cary backward onto some spikes protruding from the wall, impaling him as blood spills dramatically from Cary's mouth while Joe and Charles watch the scene unfold. Joe departs, and Mr. and Mrs. Kaznyk exchange a meaningful look. Outside, Joe rides his bicycle across the quiet, residential street to his house, where Jack's patrol car is parked in the driveway. Joe enters the house, makes his way through the kitchen, and into the living room, only to find his father weeping in the bathroom. Joe, shocked by the sight, quietly shuts the door. Later, Jack and Joe sit together at a table in Carol's Diner. As they eat, Jack hands Joe a leaflet, and Joe appears unconvinced while Jack takes a sip from a bottle of beer, regarding Joe with a sincere expression before turning his attention back to the pamphlet.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: The atmospheric silhouette of a young boy, who is riding a bicycle with a sense of purpose, is notably enhanced by the presence of a rotund alien nestled snugly within the confines of a basket that is securely attached to the bicycle's handlebars. This scene takes place in front of a vast, luminous full moon that casts its radiant glow across the landscape. In the meantime, a small, industrious robot is seen scurrying back and forth with energetic determination, moving swiftly through the long, gently swaying grass that grows beneath a sky filled with scattered clouds. Suddenly, the robot comes to an abrupt halt and blinks its mechanical eyes as if processing some new information. Within the confines of the Lillian Steel Foundry, a dramatic cascade of bright, scintillating sparks showers down like an industrial waterfall. On a snowy street, a detached house stands quietly, with a police car prominently parked in the driveway. A boy, named Joe Lamb, who appears to be about 14 years of age, sits with a forlorn expression on a swing in the garden. He gazes down in a somber manner at a locket he holds delicately in his hand. Inside the house, a wake is in progress. Mr. and Mrs. Kaznyk peer out inquisitively through the window, observing Joe in the garden. Nearby, a group of other boys lingers around a buffet table, quietly conversing. Outside, an American 1970s yellow Coupe, with a sleek and striking black vinyl roof, pulls up in front of the house with a sense of purpose. From his vantage point on the swing, Joe watches as a handsome man, with shoulder-length blonde hair and an air of confidence, named Lewis, steps out of the car. Lewis glances briefly at Joe, then, with a casual gesture, adjusts his hair before proceeding to enter the house. Joe continues to watch intently as his father, Jack, who is a man with dark hair and appears to be around 40 years old, forcefully escorts Lewis back outside and unceremoniously shoves him into the back of the police car parked in the driveway. Jack notices Joe watching with a look of apprehension, and then climbs into the patrol car, driving away with the vehicle's lights flashing as it steadily disappears up the road. Joe watches the car gradually vanish into the distance before turning his attention back to the locket, which he holds protectively in his hand, snapping it shut with a decisive click of finality. As the doors of Lillian Middle School close for the summer holidays, excited pupils pour out with joy and anticipation, retrieving their bicycles from the bike rack. Joe is among the throng of students, blending into the crowd. One of the boys from the wake, Charles, approaches him with a sense of urgency. Joe looks visibly shocked, for in their movie, a boy named Martin plays the role of a detective with intensity, while another boy, Cary, takes on the character of a zombie. Martin brandishes a gun with a sense of authority, but Cary swiftly knocks it from his grasp with unexpected force. They engage in a fierce struggle, culminating in Martin forcefully shoving Cary backward onto some ominous spikes protruding from the wall, impaling him as blood spills with dramatic effect from Cary's mouth, while Joe and Charles watch the scene unfold with fascination. Joe eventually departs, and Mr. and Mrs. Kaznyk exchange a knowing, meaningful look. Outside, Joe rides his bicycle across the quiet, residential street to his house, where Jack's patrol car stands parked in the driveway. Joe enters the house, making his way through the kitchen and into the living room, only to find his father weeping quietly in the solitude of the bathroom. Joe, taken aback by the unexpected sight, quietly shuts the door to offer privacy. Later, Jack and Joe sit together at a table in Carol's Diner, sharing a meal. As they eat, Jack hands Joe a leaflet, and Joe appears unconvinced and slightly skeptical. Jack takes a sip from a bottle of beer, regarding Joe with a sincere expression of concern and contemplation before turning his attention back to the pamphlet, signaling the importance of the moment.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The scene begins with the shadow of a boy pedaling a bicycle, the silhouette of a dumpy alien nestled in the handlebar basket, as they glide past the luminous, full moon. Meanwhile, a small robot scurries energetically back and forth through the long grass, its movements quick and purposeful beneath a sky thick with clouds. The robot comes to an abrupt halt, its mechanical eyes blinking with a soft whir. In another location, sparks cascade like a fiery waterfall within the Lillian Steel Foundry, illuminating the industrial space with bursts of light. On a snowy street, a detached house stands quietly, a police car parked conspicuously in the driveway. In the garden, a boy named Joe Lamb, around 14 years old, sits on a swing, his demeanor somber as he gazes down at a locket he holds in his hand. Inside the house, a wake is taking place, and Mr. and Mrs. Kaznyk peer out through the window, their eyes settling on Joe. Nearby, a group of boys congregates around a buffet table, their presence a backdrop to the unfolding scene. Outside, an American 1970s yellow Coupe with a black vinyl roof rolls to a stop in front of the house. From his perch on the swing, Joe observes as a striking man with shoulder-length blonde hair, named Lewis, emerges from the car. Lewis casts a glance in Joe's direction, casually adjusts his hair, and strides into the house. Joe's attention remains fixed as his father, Jack, forcefully escorts Lewis back outside, shoving him into the rear of the police car parked in the driveway. Jack, a man with dark hair in his forties, notices Joe's apprehensive gaze and then climbs into the patrol car, driving away with the lights flashing. Joe watches the car disappear up the road, then lowers his eyes back to the locket, snapping it shut with a decisive click. The scene shifts to Lillian Middle School, where a wave of excited pupils pours out as the school closes for the summer holidays. Bicycles are retrieved from the bike rack, and Joe is among the throng of students. Charles, one of the boys from the wake, approaches Joe, who appears shocked as they discuss their movie. In the film, a boy named Martin portrays a detective, while another boy, Cary, plays a zombie. Martin brandishes a gun, but Cary swiftly knocks it from his grasp. A struggle ensues, culminating in Martin shoving Cary onto spikes protruding from a wall, impaling him as blood dribbles from Cary's mouth, all while Joe and Charles watch the scene unfold. Joe departs, leaving Mr. and Mrs. Kaznyk to exchange a knowing look. Outside, Joe mounts his bicycle and pedals across the tranquil residential street to his home, where Jack's patrol car is parked in the driveway. Joe enters the house, navigates through the kitchen, and proceeds to the living room, only to find his father weeping in the bathroom. The door closes on a stunned Joe. Later, at Carol's Diner, Jack and Joe sit together at a table. As they eat, Jack slides a leaflet across to Joe, who examines it with skepticism. Jack takes a swig from a bottle of beer, his gaze sincere as he regards Joe before redirecting his focus to the pamphlet.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The shadow of a boy cycling with an alien in his bike's handlebar basket passes in front of a full moon. Meanwhile, a small robot races through long grass under a cloudy sky before stopping and blinking. Sparks fly in the Lillian Steel Foundry. On a snowy street, a detached house with a police car in the driveway hosts a wake. Joe Lamb, a glum 14-year-old, sits on a swing in the garden, looking at a locket. Inside, Mr. and Mrs. Kaznyk observe Joe through the window, while other boys stand by a buffet table. A 1970s yellow Coupe with a black vinyl roof arrives, and Lewis, a good-looking man with shoulder-length blonde hair, exits, glances at Joe, adjusts his hair, and enters the house. Joe watches as his father, Jack, escorts Lewis out and into the police car before driving off with its lights flashing. Joe watches the car disappear, then snaps the locket shut. As Lillian Middle School closes for summer, excited pupils, including Joe, spill out, retrieving bicycles. Charles, a boy from the wake, approaches Joe, who looks shocked as they watch a scene from their movie where Martin, playing a detective, and Cary, a zombie, tussle until Cary is impaled. Joe leaves, and Mr. and Mrs. Kaznyk exchange a look. Joe cycles home across the quiet street, finding Jack's patrol car in the driveway. Inside, he discovers his father weeping in the bathroom and quietly shuts the door. Later, at Carol's Diner, Jack and Joe eat together. Jack hands Joe a leaflet, and Joe looks unconvinced as Jack takes a sip of beer, regards Joe sincerely, and then turns his attention to the pamphlet.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The shadow of a boy cycling a bike with a dumpy alien in the handlebar basket passes in front of a full moon, much like the iconic scene from the 1982 film "E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial," which captured imaginations worldwide. A small robot races back and forth through long grass, under a cloudy sky reminiscent of the unpredictable weather typical of the English countryside. The robot stops and blinks with the curiosity reminiscent of the famous droid R2-D2 from "Star Wars." Sparks shower in the Lillian Steel Foundry, once a thriving factory during the Industrial Revolution but now a relic of the past. A detached house on a snowy street has a police car on the drive, and a boy, Joe Lamb, sits on a swing in the garden. He's about 14 and glumly looks down at a locket that he's holding, a keepsake from his late mother whose funeral is being observed in the wake. Mr. and Mrs. Kaznyk, the kind elderly neighbors always looking out for Joe, gaze at him through the window. Some other boys stand by a buffet table set up with homemade dishes and store-bought treats. An American 1970s yellow Coupe, reminiscent of the iconic muscle cars of that era, with a black vinyl roof, pulls up outside the house. Joe, from the swing, watches as a good-looking man with shoulder-length blonde hair, Lewis, gets out of the car, glances at Joe with a hint of recognition, adjusts his hair, and goes into the house. Joe watches as his dad, Jack, bundles Lewis outside and shoves him into the back of the police car on the drive, quieting the neighborhood gossip about their disagreements. Jack, a dark-haired man of about 40, sees an apprehensive Joe watching him, then gets in the patrol car and drives it off with its lights flashing down the serene suburban streets. Joe watches as it disappears up the road and looks back down at the locket he's holding, a cherished connection to his mother, before snapping it shut. Excited pupils spill out of Lillian Middle School, known for its spirited community events, as it closes for the summer holidays, bicycles are taken out of a bike rack, and Joe is amongst the throng of pupils. One boy from the wake, Charles, comes over to him, an aspiring filmmaker always carrying his camera. Joe looks shocked, as in their movie, a boy, Martin, plays a detective character while another boy, Cary, is a zombie, part of their ongoing homemade film project inspired by the horror films of George A. Romero. Martin pulls a gun, a replica toy prop, but Cary knocks it from his hand in an unexpected show of strength. They tussle, and Martin shoves Cary back onto some spikes on the wall, impaling him as blood, a special effects mixture of corn syrup and food coloring, spills from Cary's mouth while Joe and Charles watch. Joe leaves, and Mr. and Mrs. Kaznyk, sharing a knowing glance, reflect on his resilience. Outside, Joe cycles across the quiet residential street to his house where Jack's patrol car is on the drive. Joe goes inside, makes his way through the well-kept kitchen to the living room, and finds his father weeping in the bathroom, consumed by grief from recent events, and shuts the door on the shocked Joe. Later, Jack and Joe are at a table in Carol's Diner, a local eatery known for its warm atmosphere and mouth-watering pies. As they eat, Jack hands Joe a leaflet, suggesting a summer camp focused on filmmaking, and Joe looks unconvinced while Jack takes a pull on a bottle of beer and regards Joe sincerely before turning his attention to the pamphlet.

test_cases.description: The shadow of a boy cycling a bike with a dumpy alien in the handlebar basket passes in front of a full moon. A small robot races back and forth through long grass under a cloudy sky. The robot stops and blinks. Sparks shower in the Lillian Steel Foundry. A detached house on a snowy street has a police car on the drive and a boy Joe Lamb sits on a swing in the garden. He is about 14 and glumly looks down at a locket that he is holding. A wake is being held inside the house. Mr and Mrs Kaznyk look at Joe through the window. Some other boys stand by a buffet table. An American 1970s yellow Coupe with a black vinyl roof pulls up outside the house. Joe from the swing watches as a goodlooking man with shoulderlength blonde hair. Lewis gets out of the car glances at Joe adjusts his hair and goes into the house. Joe watches as his dad. Jack bundles Lewis outside and shoves him into the back of the police car on the drive. Jack a darkhaired man of about 40 sees an apprehensive Joe watching him. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Joe leaves and Mr and Mrs Kaznyk exchange a look. Outside. Joe cycles across the quiet residential street to his house where Jack's patrol car is on the drive. Joe goes inside makes his way through the kitchen to the living room and finds his father weeping in the bathroom and shuts the door on the shocked Joe. Later Jack and Joe are at a table in Carol's Diner. As they eat Jack hands Joe a leaflet and Joe looks unconvinced while Jack takes a pull on a bottle of beer and regards Joe sincerely before turning his attention to the pamphlet.

A small robot races back and forth through long grass under a cloudy sky. The robot stops and blinks. Sparks shower in the Lillian Steel Foundry. A detached house on a snowy street has a police car on the drive and a boy Joe Lamb sits on a swing in the garden. He is about 14 and glumly looks down at a locket that he is holding. A wake is being held inside the house. Mr and Mrs Kaznyk look at Joe through the window. Some other boys stand by a buffet table. Lewis gets out of the car glances at Joe adjusts his hair and goes into the house. Joe watches as his dad. Jack bundles Lewis outside and shoves him into the back of the police car on the drive. test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: The shadow of a giraffe cycling a bike with a dumpy penguin in the handlebar basket passes in front of a full moon. A small dinosaur races back and forth through long grass, under a cloudy sky. The dinosaur stops and blinks. Sparks shower in the Lillian Steel Foundry. A detached house on a snowy street has a police car on the drive, and a cat, Joe Lamb, sits on a swing in the garden. It's about 14 and glumly looks down at a locket that it's holding. A wake is being held inside the house. Mr. and Mrs. Squirrel look at the cat through the window. Some other cats stand by a buffet table. An American 1970s yellow Coupe with a black vinyl roof pulls up outside the house. The cat, from the swing, watches as a good-looking fish with shoulder-length blonde scales, Lewis, gets out of the car, glances at the cat, adjusts its scales, and goes into the house. The cat watches as its trainer, Jack, bundles Lewis outside and shoves it into the back of the police car on the drive. Jack, a dark-haired horse of about 40, sees an apprehensive cat watching him, then gets in the patrol car and drives it off with its lights flashing. The cat watches as it disappears up the road and looks back down at the locket it's holding before snapping it shut. Excited teapots spill out of Lillian Middle School as it closes for the summer holidays, bicycles are taken out of a bike rack, and the cat is amongst the throng of teapots. One cat from the wake, Charles, comes over to it. The cat looks shocked, as in their movie, a tree, Martin, plays a detective character while another tree, Cary, is a zombie. Martin pulls a gun, but Cary knocks it from its branches. They tussle, and Martin shoves Cary back onto some spikes on the wall, impaling it as blood spills from Cary's mouth while the cat and Charles watch. The cat leaves, and Mr. and Mrs. Squirrel exchange a look. Outside, the cat cycles across the quiet residential street to its house where Jack's patrol car is on the drive. The cat goes inside, makes its way through the kitchen to the living room, and finds its trainer weeping in the bathroom and shuts the door on the shocked cat. Later, Jack and the cat are at a table in Carol's Diner. As they eat, Jack hands the cat a leaflet, and the cat looks unconvinced while Jack takes a pull on a bottle of beer and regards the cat sincerely before turning his attention to the pamphlet.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The shadow of a boy cycling a tricycle with a dumpy octopus in the handlebar basket passes in front of a full stadium. A small turtle races back and forth through tall flowers, under a starry sky. The turtle stops and blinks. Sparks shower in the Lillian Glassworks. A detached cabin on a sandy beach has a fire truck on the drive, and a boy, Joe Lamb, sits on a hammock in the garden. He's about 14 and glumly looks down at a compass that he's holding. A festival is being held inside the cabin. Mr. and Mrs. Kaznyk look at Joe through the window. Some other boys stand by a dessert table. An American 1970s blue Sedan with a red vinyl roof pulls up outside the cabin. Joe, from the hammock, watches as a good-looking man with shoulder-length blonde hair, Lewis, gets out of the truck, glances at Joe, adjusts his hair, and goes into the cabin. Joe watches as his dad, Jack, bundles Lewis outside and shoves him into the back of the fire truck on the drive. Jack, a dark-haired man of about 40, sees an apprehensive Joe watching him, then gets in the rescue truck and drives it off with its lights flashing. Joe watches as it disappears up the trail and looks back down at the compass he's holding before snapping it shut. Excited passengers spill out of Lillian Train Station as it closes for the summer holidays, scooters are taken out of a rack, and Joe is amongst the throng of passengers. One boy from the festival, Charles, comes over to him. Joe looks shocked, as in their play, a boy, Martin, plays a scientist character while another boy, Cary, is a ghost. Martin pulls a net, but Cary knocks it from his hand. They tussle, and Martin shoves Cary back onto some vines on the fence, tangling him as jelly spills from Cary's mouth while Joe and Charles watch. Joe leaves, and Mr. and Mrs. Kaznyk exchange a look. Outside, Joe scooters across the quiet marina street to his house where Jack's rescue truck is on the drive. Joe goes inside, makes his way through the pantry to the living room, and finds his father weeping in the study and shuts the door on the shocked Joe. Later, Jack and Joe are at a table in Carol's Café. As they eat, Jack hands Joe a brochure, and Joe looks unconvinced while Jack takes a pull on a bottle of soda and regards Joe sincerely before turning his attention to the leaflet.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The shadow of a boy skipping with a dumpy alien in the handlebar basket glides in front of a full moon. A small robot twirls back and forth through long grass, under a cloudy sky. The robot pauses and whistles. Fireworks explode in the Lillian Steel Foundry. A detached house on a snowy street has a police car parked on the drive, and a boy, Joe Lamb, reclines on a swing in the garden. He's about 14 and merrily tosses a locket that he's holding. A party is happening inside the house. Mr. and Mrs. Kaznyk peek at Joe through the window. Some other boys dance by a buffet table. An American 1970s yellow Coupe with a black vinyl roof rolls up outside the house. Joe, from the swing, observes as a good-looking man with shoulder-length blonde hair, Lewis, leaps out of the car, nods at Joe, fixes his hair, and strolls into the house. Joe observes as his dad, Jack, guides Lewis outside and nudges him into the back of the police car on the drive. Jack, a dark-haired man of about 40, notices an apprehensive Joe observing him, then hops into the patrol car and zooms it off with its lights flashing. Joe observes as it cruises up the road and gazes back down at the locket he's holding before opening it wide. Jubilant pupils prance out of Lillian Middle School as it closes for the summer holidays, bicycles are removed from a bike rack, and Joe is amidst the throng of pupils. One boy from the party, Charles, approaches him. Joe looks surprised, as in their movie, a boy, Martin, portrays a detective character while another boy, Cary, is a zombie. Martin brandishes a gun, but Cary swipes it from his hand. They wrestle, and Martin pulls Cary into some spikes on the wall, pinning him as paint pours from Cary's mouth while Joe and Charles observe. Joe departs, and Mr. and Mrs. Kaznyk exchange a glance. Outside, Joe dances across the quiet residential street to his house where Jack's patrol car is parked on the drive. Joe enters, meanders through the kitchen to the living room, and discovers his father singing in the bathroom and slides the door closed on the startled Joe. Later, Jack and Joe are at a booth in Carol's Diner. As they chat, Jack passes Joe a leaflet, and Joe looks puzzled while Jack sips on a bottle of beer and contemplates Joe sincerely before diverting his attention to the pamphlet.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The reflection of a squirrel skateboarding a scooter with a squishy unicorn in the cargo basket glides in front of a bright lantern. A large toaster zooms back and forth through tall bushes, under a foggy horizon. The toaster pauses and twinkles. Bubbles cascade in the Emerald Fabric Factory. An inflatable castle on a sandy beach has a fire truck on the pier, and a cactus, Zoe Leaf, reclines on a hammock in the jungle. It's about 14 feet tall and wistfully gazes down at a yo-yo that it's holding. A parade is being hosted outside the castle. Dr. and Dr. Snorky glance at Zoe through the binoculars. Some other cacti hover by a cake stand. A British 1980s pink Sedan with a green velvet sail docks beneath the castle. Zoe, from the hammock, observes as a glamorous cloud with rainbow-length azure tail, Willow, steps out of the ship, peeks at Zoe, adjusts its tail, and floats into the castle. Zoe observes as its owl, Max, flings Willow outside and catapults it into the front of the fire truck on the pier. Max, a golden-tailed owl of about 40 inches, notices a startled Zoe observing it, then climbs in the rescue truck and sails it off with its sirens flashing. Zoe observes as it vanishes down the path and glances back down at the yo-yo it's holding before snapping it closed. Boisterous dolphins tumble out of Emerald Junior School as it wraps up for the winter solstice, roller skates are extracted from a skate rack, and Zoe is amidst the crowd of dolphins. One cactus from the parade, Alex, approaches it. Zoe appears startled, as in their cartoon, a cactus, Devin, acts as an astronaut character while another cactus, Jamie, is a goblin. Devin draws a wand, but Jamie knocks it from its grasp. They scuffle, and Devin hurls Jamie back onto some vines on the fence, impaling it as ketchup spills from Jamie's mouth while Zoe and Alex observe. Zoe departs, and Dr. and Dr. Snorky swap a smirk. Outdoors, Zoe roller-skates across the bustling commercial intersection to its mansion where Max's rescue truck is on the pier. Zoe enters, weaves through the pantry to the den, and discovers its owl sobbing in the attic and latches the portal on the startled Zoe. Eventually, Max and Zoe are at a booth in David's Cafe. As they munch, Max presents Zoe with a brochure, and Zoe seems doubtful while Max gulps a sip from a mug of cider and considers Zoe earnestly before redirecting its focus to the flyer.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The silhouette of a cat skateboarding a skateboard with a chubby penguin in the handlebar basket glides in front of a full moon. A big rabbit hops back and forth through tall grass, under a cloudy sky. The rabbit halts and winks. Flames cascade in the Lillian Steel Workshop. A cottage on a snowy street has a fire truck on the drive, and a girl, Ellie Lamb, perches on a seesaw in the garden. She's about 14 and wistfully gazes down at a bracelet that she's holding. A party is being held inside the house. Mr. and Mrs. Novak peer at Ellie through the window. Some other girls linger by a snack table. An Italian 1970s red Sedan with a white vinyl roof rolls up outside the house. Ellie, from the seesaw, observes as a charming woman with shoulder-length brown hair, Lisa, climbs out of the car, peeks at Ellie, adjusts her jacket, and strolls into the house. Ellie watches as her mom, Jill, drags Lisa outside and pushes her into the back of the fire truck on the drive. Jill, a dark-haired woman of about 40, notices an anxious Ellie observing her, then climbs in the fire truck and drives it off with its sirens wailing. Ellie watches as it vanishes up the road and glances back down at the bracelet she's holding before snapping it shut. Thrilled teachers swarm out of Lillian Middle School as it concludes for the summer holidays, balloons are taken out of a balloon rack, and Ellie is amongst the crowd of teachers. One girl from the party, Alice, approaches her. Ellie looks stunned, as in their play, a girl, Hannah, plays a spy character while another girl, Bella, is a ghost. Hannah brandishes a shield, but Bella swats it from her hand. They scuffle, and Hannah pushes Bella back onto some stakes on the stage, impaling her as confetti spills from Bella's mouth while Ellie and Alice watch. Ellie departs, and Mr. and Mrs. Novak exchange a glance. Outside, Ellie skateboards across the quiet suburban street to her house where Jill's fire truck is on the drive. Ellie goes inside, makes her way through the kitchen to the living room, and finds her mother laughing in the bathroom and shuts the door on the surprised Ellie. Later, Jill and Ellie are at a booth in Carol's Cafe. As they dine, Jill slides Ellie a brochure, and Ellie looks doubtful while Jill takes a sip of a glass of juice and regards Ellie warmly before turning her attention to the flyer.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The outline of a boy piloting a scooter with a clumsy penguin in the storage compartment floats in front of a crescent sun. A tiny squirrel darts side to side through tall flowers, beneath a stormy horizon. The squirrel halts and winks. Fireworks erupt in the Lillian Crystal Factory. A sprawling cabin on a sandy road has a fire truck on the lawn, and a boy, Joe Lamb, lounges on a hammock in the yard. He's about 14 and wistfully gazes up at a pebble that he's tossing. A market is being hosted inside the cabin. Mr. and Mrs. Kaznyk peek at Joe from the patio. Some other boys gather by a lemonade stand. A Japanese 1960s blue Sedan with a red plaid roof rolls up near the cabin. Joe, from the hammock, observes as an attractive woman with shoulder-length red hair, Lewis, steps out of the bus, peers at Joe, adjusts her hat, and heads into the cabin. Joe observes as his mom, Jack, ushers Lewis outside and nudges her into the trunk of the fire truck on the lawn. Jack, a curly-haired woman of about 40, notices a curious Joe observing her, then hops into the vehicle and sails it away with its horn blowing. Joe watches as it vanishes down the lane and glances back at the pebble he's tossing before dropping it. Cheerful students pour out of Lillian High School as it opens for the winter session, skateboards are grabbed from a skate park, and Joe is amongst the crowd of students. One boy from the market, Charles, approaches him. Joe looks startled, as in their screenplay, a boy, Martin, plays a superhero character while another boy, Cary, is a ghost. Martin draws a sword, but Cary swats it from his grasp. They scuffle, and Martin pushes Cary onto some branches on the fence, pinning him as water pours from Cary's mouth while Joe and Charles look on. Joe departs, and Mr. and Mrs. Kaznyk share a glance. Outside, Joe skates across the busy urban road to his cabin where Jack's fire truck is on the lawn. Joe enters, wanders through the parlor to the den, and finds his mother humming in the closet and closes the door on the puzzled Joe. Later, Jack and Joe are at a booth in Fred's Café. As they chat, Jack hands Joe a brochure, and Joe looks skeptical while Jack takes a sip from a cup of tea and regards Joe warmly before turning her gaze to the menu.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The outline of a cat juggling a balloon with a sleepy octopus in the suitcase floats above a glowing star. A giant squirrel dances up and down through thick sand, above a clear sea. The squirrel pauses and yawns. Leaves scatter in the Evergreen Lumber Yard. A cozy cabin on a sunny road has a fire truck in the driveway, and a cat, Max Whiskers, lounges in a hammock on the porch. It's around 14 months old and cheerfully gazes upon a whistle that it's gripping. A parade is being thrown outside the cabin. Mr. and Mrs. Flintstone peer at Max through the fence. Several squirrels gather by a lemonade stand. A German 1960s blue Sedan with a red leather roof rolls up near the cabin. Max, from the hammock, observes as a charming otter with curly auburn fur, Felix, hops out of the sedan, stares at Max, adjusts his fur, and strolls into the cabin. Max observes as its parent, Sam, escorts Felix outside and nudges him into the passenger seat of the fire truck in the driveway. Sam, a light-haired creature of about 40 seasons, notices a curious Max observing him, then hops in the vehicle and steers it away with its sirens wailing. Max observes as it vanishes down the path and returns to admiring the whistle it's grasping before clicking it open. Joyful foxes leap from Forest Elementary as it opens for the winter celebrations, scooters are picked up from a scooter stand, and Max is among the crowd of foxes. One squirrel from the parade, Charlie, approaches Max. Max seems stunned, as in their play, a squirrel, Martin, portrays a superhero character while another squirrel, Cary, is a pirate. Martin wields a sword, but Cary swats it from its grasp. They brawl, and Martin pushes Cary onto some thorns on the fence, spearing it as ink gushes from Cary's beak while Max and Charlie gaze. Max departs, and Mr. and Mrs. Flintstone swap a glance. Indoors, Max paddles across the bustling commercial area to its cabin where Sam's fire truck is in the driveway. Max enters, navigates through the pantry to the study, and spots its parent sobbing in the attic and latches the gate on the astounded Max. Another time, Sam and Max are at a stall in Randy's Café. As they snack, Sam offers Max a brochure, and Max seems skeptical while Sam sips from a mug of cider and contemplates Max earnestly before shifting his focus to the flyer.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: In front of a full moon, a boy cycles with an alien in his bike basket, while a small robot races through the grass. Sparks fly at Lillian Steel Foundry, and Joe Lamb, a 14-year-old boy, sits glumly on a swing outside his house, holding a locket. Inside, a wake is happening, and Joe’s father, Jack, an officer, escorts Lewis—an attractive man with long blond hair—out of the house and into a police car. Joe, still on the swing, watches them leave. As summer break begins, excited students spill out of Lillian Middle School, including Joe. Charles, a friend from the wake, approaches, and they watch as another friend, Martin, enacts a movie scene with Cary, ending in a dramatic tussle. Joe cycles home to find his father weeping in the bathroom. Later, at Carol's Diner, Jack gives Joe a leaflet, looking sincere as Joe remains unconvinced.

test_cases.name: Rotate Half Paragraph
test_cases.description: then gets in the patrol car and drives it off with its lights flashing  Joe watches as it disappears up the road and looks back down at the locket he's holding before snapping it shut  Excited pupils spill out of Lillian Middle School as it closes for the summer holidays  bicycles are taken out of a bike rack and Joe is amongst the throng of pupils  One boy from the wake Charles comes over to him  Joe looks shocked as in their movie a boy Martin plays a detective character while another boy Cary is a zombie  Martin pulls a gun but Cary knocks it from his hand  They tussle and Martin shoves Cary back onto some spikes on the wall impaling him as blood spills from Cary's mouth  while Joe and Charles watch  Joe leaves and Mr and Mrs Kaznyk exchange a look  Outside  Joe cycles across the quiet residential street to his house where Jack's patrol car is on the drive  Joe goes inside makes his way through the kitchen to the living room and finds his father weeping in the bathroom and shuts the door on the shocked Joe  Later Jack and Joe are at a table in Carol's Diner  As they eat Jack hands Joe a leaflet and Joe looks unconvinced while Jack takes a pull on a bottle of beer and regards Joe sincerely before turning his attention to the pamphlet The shadow of a boy cycling a bike with a dumpy alien in the handlebar basket passes in front of a full moon  A small robot races back and forth through long grass under a cloudy sky  The robot stops and blinks  Sparks shower in the Lillian Steel Foundry  A detached house on a snowy street has a police car on the drive and a boy Joe Lamb sits on a swing in the garden  He's about 14 and glumly looks down at a locket that he's holding  A wake is being held inside the house  Mr and Mrs Kaznyk look at Joe through the window  Some other boys stand by a buffet table  An American 1970s yellow Coupe with a black vinyl roof pulls up outside the house  Joe from the swing watches as a goodlooking man with shoulderlength blonde hair  Lewis gets out of the car glances at Joe adjusts his hair and goes into the house  Joe watches as his dad  Jack bundles Lewis outside and shoves him into the back of the police car on the drive  Jack a darkhaired man of about 40 sees an apprehensive Joe watching him
